intro: Askidiosperma esterhuyseniae, commonly known as the Esterhuysenia tree, is a member of the Fabaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland ecosystems. The tree is valued for its hard, durable wood and has some traditional medicinal uses among local communities.
